verses.text_plain: Gather yourselves together, yea, gather together, O nation not desired;
verses.verse_html:
1Gather yourselves together, yea, gather together, O nation not desired; ▼
▼ not…: or, not desirous

footnotes.body_html: ▼ not…: or, not desirous

verses.text_plain: Before the decree bring forth, before the day pass as the chaff, before the fierce anger of the Lord come upon you, before the day of the Lord’s anger come upon you.
verses.verse_html: 2Before the decree bring forth, before the day pass as the chaff, before the fierce anger of the Lord come upon you, before the day of the Lord’s anger come upon you.

verses.text_plain: Seek ye the Lord, all ye meek of the earth, which have wrought his judgment; seek righteousness, seek meekness: it may be ye shall be hid in the day of the Lord’s anger.
verses.verse_html: 3Seek ye the Lord, all ye meek of the earth, which have wrought his judgment; seek righteousness, seek meekness: it may be ye shall be hid in the day of the Lord’s anger.

verses.text_plain: For Gaza shall be forsaken, and Ashkelon a desolation: they shall drive out Ashdod at the noon day, and Ekron shall be rooted up.
verses.verse_html: 4For Gaza shall be forsaken, and Ashkelon a desolation: they shall drive out Ashdod at the noon day, and Ekron shall be rooted up.

verses.text_plain: Woe unto the inhabitants of the sea coast, the nation of the Cherethites! the word of the Lord is against you; O Canaan, the land of the Philistines, I will even destroy thee, that there shall be no inhabitant.
verses.verse_html: 5Woe unto the inhabitants of the sea coast, the nation of the Cherethites! the word of the Lord is against you; O Canaan, the land of the Philistines, I will even destroy thee, that there shall be no inhabitant.

tokens.text: thee, that there shall be no inhabitant

verses.text_plain: And the sea coast shall be dwellings and cottages for shepherds, and folds for flocks.
verses.verse_html: 6And the sea coast shall be dwellings and cottages for shepherds, and folds for flocks.

verses.text_plain: And the coast shall be for the remnant of the house of Judah; they shall feed thereupon: in the houses of Ashkelon shall they lie down in the evening: for the Lord their God shall visit them, and turn away their captivity.
verses.verse_html:
7And the coast shall be for the remnant of the house of Judah; they shall feed thereupon: in the houses of Ashkelon shall they lie down in the evening: for the Lord their God shall visit them, and turn away their captivity. ▼
▼ for the Lord: or, when, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ for the Lord: or, when, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ for the Lord: or, when, etc

verses.text_plain: I have heard the reproach of Moab, and the revilings of the children of Ammon, whereby they have reproached my people, and magnified themselves against their border.
verses.verse_html: 8I have heard the reproach of Moab, and the revilings of the children of Ammon, whereby they have reproached my people, and magnified themselves against their border.

verses.text_plain: Therefore as I live, saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, Surely Moab shall be as Sodom, and the children of Ammon as Gomorrah, even the breeding of nettles, and saltpits, and a perpetual desolation: the residue of my people shall spoil them, and the remnant of my people shall possess them.
verses.verse_html: 9Therefore as I live, saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, Surely Moab shall be as Sodom, and the children of Ammon as Gomorrah, even the breeding of nettles, and saltpits, and a perpetual desolation: the residue of my people shall spoil them, and the remnant of my people shall possess them.

verses.text_plain: This shall they have for their pride, because they have reproached and magnified themselves against the people of the Lord of hosts.
verses.verse_html: 10This shall they have for their pride, because they have reproached and magnified themselves against the people of the Lord of hosts.

tokens.text: This shall they have for their pride

verses.text_plain: The Lord will be terrible unto them: for he will famish all the gods of the earth; and men shall worship him, every one from his place, even all the isles of the heathen.
verses.verse_html:
11The Lord will be terrible unto them: for he will famish all the gods of the earth; and men shall worship him, every one from his place, even all the isles of the heathen. ▼
▼ famish: Heb. make lean

tokens.text: unto them: for he will famish

footnotes.body_html: ▼ famish: Heb. make lean

verses.text_plain: Ye Ethiopians also, ye shall be slain by my sword.
verses.verse_html: 12Ye Ethiopians also, ye shall be slain by my sword.

verses.text_plain: And he will stretch out his hand against the north, and destroy Assyria; and will make Nineveh a desolation, and dry like a wilderness.
verses.verse_html: 13And he will stretch out his hand against the north, and destroy Assyria; and will make Nineveh a desolation, and dry like a wilderness.

verses.text_plain: And flocks shall lie down in the midst of her, all the beasts of the nations: both the cormorant and the bittern shall lodge in the upper lintels of it; their voice shall sing in the windows; desolation shall be in the thresholds: for he shall uncover the cedar work.
verses.verse_html:
14And flocks shall lie down in the midst of her, all the beasts of the nations: both the cormorant and the bittern shall lodge in the upper lintels of it; their voice shall sing in the windows; desolation shall be in the thresholds: for he shall uncover the cedar work. ▼
▼ cormorant: or, pelican
 , ▼
▼ upper…: or, knops, or, chapiters
 , ▼
▼ for…: or, when he hath uncovered

footnotes.body_html: ▼ upper…: or, knops, or, chapiters

footnotes.body_text: ▼ for…: or, when he hath uncovered
footnotes.body_html: ▼ for…: or, when he hath uncovered

verses.text_plain: This is the rejoicing city that dwelt carelessly, that said in her heart, I am, and there is none beside me: how is she become a desolation, a place for beasts to lie down in! every one that passeth by her shall hiss, and wag his hand.
verses.verse_html: 15This is the rejoicing city that dwelt carelessly, that said in her heart, I am, and there is none beside me: how is she become a desolation, a place for beasts to lie down in! every one that passeth by her shall hiss, and wag his hand.

tokens.text: me: how is she become a desolation
